page.title: 04Dairy Farming
page.content: Hineswood Farm is a hill dairy farm on the side of Congleton Edge.It overlooks the Cheshire Plain.There are 72 acres of land of which 30 acres are for hay and 5 acres for silage.The rest of the land is hill pasture except for 15 acres of woodland,stream and valley slope.The farmer has 57 cows.None of them are dry.About 75% of them are in calf.They are mostly British Friesians.The milk quota is 337,000 litres per year.This is the amount the farmer may produce in a year.The farmer receives 6.5-7.5p per pint and the milk is sold to the general public at 23p per pint.The cows remain in during the winter and the farmers wife milks them and changes their bedding.
